------=_NextPart_000_0149_01C0833D.223C6140
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Serge thought he got far enough away and looked back. He started to boil up=
 with fury. He turned around and stared down at Perplex.

Perplex: I heard =
your whining as you ran.

Serge: (Mumbles something not understandable)

Pe=
rplex: I'll give you a head start, RUN!

Serge just stood there looking at =
Perplex. Perplex raised his hand, showing the disk he was powering earlier.=
 He started to make it grow larger and glow more brightly and pulsate faste=
r. Serge walked slowly backwards.

Perplex: Run faster than that if you val=
ue life.

Serge continued to move slowly, planning to duck the disk.

Meanw=
hile, Clash flew along, wondering why he had been forced to run by those fo=
ols back there. His arm was growing back now.

Clash: How could I, it isn't=
 possible, I am the ultimate being, the SUPREME being, I am perfection, I c=
an't be beaten! It's not right, what happened? A hex? SOmething, something,=
 huh, huh...

(At the Cybertronian Fire)

Deemos: Shokaract, you fool! We w=
ere ordered to cease fire! I've got to get out of here.

Deemos flew off aw=
ay from the battle, contacting Sharpedge.

Deemos: Sharpedge, you're in com=
mand of my position, I can't stand to be there anymore.

Tarantopulous look=
ed around him. Maximals, still firing, worse than him even. Why do they act=
 this way? It was only a cease fire? Tarantopulous pondered this. After all=
, as soon as the Maximals get their guy back, then they could fire again, r=
ight? They were just making things harder.

Tarantopulous (To Kluster): Sir=
, they are all still firing. This is suicide. You have shown me the light, =
and I am most certain that they are killing  themselves! I can't take this.=


With that, Tarantopulous ran from the battle, catching the attention of D=
eemos on his way...
